titles: The Spanish masquerado VVherein vnder a pleasant deuise, is discouered effectuallie, in certaine breefe sentences and mottos, the pride and insolencie of the Spanish estate: with the disgrace conceiued by their losse, and the dismaied confusion of their tronbled [sic] thoughtes. Whereunto by the author, for the better vnderstanding of his deuice, is added a breefe glosse. By Robert Greene, in Artibus Magister. ...
author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.
Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601.
publisher: By Roger Ward, for Thomas Cadman,
notes: In this edition A2r is signed "Robert Greene" in italic; only sections 11 and 12 are numbered in the text. Quire A outer forme and most of E inner forme are in the same setting as STC 12309.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Spain --  History --  Philip II, 1556-1598 --  Early works to 1800.
Spain --  Politics and government --  1556-1598 --  Early works to 1800.
